text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Several thousand candidates are starting the race for November 17 local elections which will be contested by 28 political parties and as many independent candidates.
- NATO Secretary Generl Javier Solana to visit Macedonia in December. Macedonia expects to be the last country on his tour of Patnership for Peace member countries.
- Albanian students of Skopje's Education faculty boycott Macedonian language classes. They demand all classess to be in Albanian.
- Foreign medical experts are investigating reasons of the poisoning of Albanian children in Tetovo. They will remain in Tetovo longer to contact the patients.
- Famous doctor Jovially Ugrinovski who operated on Macedonian President Kiro Gligorov and saved his life is the candidate of the ruling SDAM for Skopje mayor.
- Macedonian Deputy Prime minister Jane Miljovski has sustained light injuries in a car accident close to the Bulgarian border. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom +389 91 201196
